title.narrative: GROWING FORESTRY CAPACITY IN HAITI

description.narrative: To extend Forest Service efforts to improve forest policies and practices internationally, address climate change, conserve and protect critical global forest environments and resources, and improve the lives of forest-dependent peoples by awarding grants to and entering into cooperative agreements with nonprofit organizations, multilateral organizations, and other individuals, organizations, institutions, and governments engaged in forest conservation and management.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: State and Private Forestry, Forest Service

title.narrative: APHIS/VS

description.narrative: Activity 1 : Subject matter experts from APHIS-VS participated at the following meetings related to Swine Diseases and Classical Swine Fever (the meetings were held in Port au Prince, Haiti): 1) CSF-GFTAD-FAO meeting (1 day); 2) Swine Diseases Working Group Meeting of the CaribVET (2 days) and; 3) CSF Senior Review Meetings (2 days). Additionally, a VS subject matter expert traveled to the field to review CSF field operations (vaccination, surveillance) in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. VS subject matter expert also assisted in the review of the status of the APHIS special project for the installation of RT PCR diagnostics at the National Veterinary Laboratories in Haiti and DR. Budget; Activity 2 : Since 2008, NVSL/FADDL, has been assisting the Classical Swine Fever (CSF) eradication program in Hispaniola (Haiti and DR) by providing technical advice and improving the diagnostic capacity of the National Veterinary Laboratories (NVL) of both countries. Since the first observation of Teschen disease (TD) in Haiti in February of 2009, APHIS-VS and APHIS-IS, have been actively inv

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Fruit Fly Capacity Building

description.narrative: The objective of this visit was to continue capacity building in the areas of fruit fly trapping and record keeping in support of the Mango pre-clearance program. APHIS/IS and PPQ conducted the second trip to Haiti to provide guidance and assistance to the Ministry of Agriculture on their trapping and record keeping obligations under the Mango pre clearance program. The work supported under the FAS PASA agreement with USAID, is the second of several trips planned during the next several months in an effort to enable Ministry Officials to fulfill obligations as outlined in the preclearance workplan for Haiti mangoes. .

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Greater Caribbean Safeguarding Initiative

description.narrative: Under the Greater Caribbean Safeguarding Initiative an effort to harmonize Fruit fly trapping and record keeping among countries in the Caribbean basin including Haiti is one the on-going projects. This effort in Haiti will also involve the APHIS preclearance staff who will work in conjunction with Ministry counterparts under the Mango program preclearance workplan to ensure that trapping and subsequent record keeping work is being conducted in the prescribed manner and on and on-going basis. Marco Gonzalez of APHIS Costa Rica, has conducted this work in other GCSI countries and with the concurrence of John Shaw, has agreed to travel to Haiti the week of September 10th to begin working with the Ministry and to include Haiti in his initiative to harmonize regional fruit fly data

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Haiti - Ministry Officials Visit Guatemala Medfly Program

description.narrative: Haiti has established active surveillance for the Mediterranean fruit fly (Medfly), which established in the neighboring Dominican Republic (DR) in early 2015. The Medfly has spread from the point of introduction in the eastern part of the DR halfway across the country, toward Haiti.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses
Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service, Salaries and Expenses

title.narrative: Haiti - Technical assistance to Mango pre-clearance program

description.narrative: Marco Gonzalez, APHIS/Costa Rica over the last two years has been funded to provide technical assistance to Haitian cooperators and other stakeholders supporting the Mango preclearance program under a USDA/FAS PASA agreement. The objective of the visit was to initiate the 2016 work-plan which included technical assistance to the cooperators and preclearance program staff regarding the operational aspects of the exotic pest surveillance network developed to provide early warning for Haiti mango producers.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Technical Services under The Economic and Food Security Program to revitalize and modernize the Haitian Agricultural Sector

description.narrative: Support USDA's contribution to the US Government's collective efforts to revitalize and modernize the Haitian agricultural sector. Activities undertaken will strengthen the institutional capacity of the Haitian Ministry of Agriculture to deliver essential services in research, education, education, extension, and market information to agricultural producers; assist the Ministry of Agriculture in the decentralization process by strengthening institutional capacities and capabilities at the department and local levels; enhance food security and the nutritional status of the rural population and engage with private sector entities to increase productivity and efficiency along select agricultural value chains.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles

title.narrative: Food for Progress

description.narrative: The Food for Progress Program provides for the donation of U.S. agricultural commodities to developing countries and emerging democracies that are committed to introducing or expanding free enterprise in their agricultural economies. The program has two primary strategic objectives: (1) increase agricultural productivity and (2) expand trade of agricultural products.

title.narrative: McGovern-Dole Program

description.narrative: The McGovern-Dole program provides for the donation of agricultural commodities and the provision of financial and technical assistance to improve the education, food security and health of school-age children, especially girls, in developing countries.

title.narrative: Micronutrient-fortified Food Aid Products Pilot Program

description.narrative: The Micronutrient-Fortified Food Aid Products Pilot (MFFAPP) is administered under the McGovern-Dole Program. Under MFFAPP, participants will develop and field test new or improved micronutrient-fortified food aid products designed to meet the energy and nutrient needs of populations served by McGovern-Dole Program. Through this effort, USDA hopes to identify new products that would be readily available for distribution through the McGovern-Dole Program

title.narrative: McGovern-Dole Program

description.narrative: The McGovern-Dole program provides for the donation of agricultural commodities and the provision of financial and technical assistance to improve the education, food security and health of school-age children, especially girls, in developing countries.

person-name.narrative: Daniel Herche and Tyson Whitney; Ryan Boles
